free_txt: N.O.
S.W. JOURNAL REFERENCE ADDED.

bib_record.title: -NEUTRON ELASTIC AND INELASTIC SCATTERING FROM BERYLLIUM, NITROGEN AND OXYGEN AT EN = 21.6 MEV.

free_txt: STUDSVIK 6 MV VAN DE GRAAFF ACCELERATOR, EQUIPPED
WITH A TERMINAL PULSING AND KLYSTRON BUNCHING SYSTEM,
AS WELL AS A POST-ACCELERATION BUNCHER. DELIVERED
BURSTS OF 5 MEV DEUTERONS AT A REPETITION RATE OF 1
MHZ WITH A PULSE WIDTH AT HALF MAXIMUM OF LESS THAN
0.3 NS AND AN AVERAGE BEAM CURRENT OF 3 MICROAMPS.
.CORRECTIONS WERE APPLIED FOR THE VARIATION OF THE
DETECTOR EFFICIENCY WITH ENERGY, ANISOTROPY OF THE
NEUTRONS FROM THE D-T REACTION, FINITE SCATTERING
GEOMETRY, FLUX ATTENUATION AND MULTIPLE SCATTERING.
TWO IDENTICAL 12.7 CM DIAMETER BY 5.1 CM THICK
NE 213 LIQUID SCINTILLATORS, MOUNTED ON FAST PHOTO-
MULTIPLIER TUBES, WERE USED TO MEASURE THE ANGULAR
DISTRIBUTIONS OF SCATTERED NEUTRONS. THE DETECTORS
WERE SEPARATED BY 5 DEGREES AND WERE POSITIONED IN A
HEAVY SHIELDING. WITH A LOWER LEVEL DISCRIMINATOR SET
AT 3 MEV NEUTRON ENERGY, EXCELLENT N-GAMMA DISCRIMI-
NATION AND INTRINSIC TIME RESOLUTION WAS OBTAINED. A
70 CM LONG HEVIMET SHADOW BAR PROTECTED THE DETECTORS
FROM THE DIRECT TARGET FLUX. THE SYSTEM COULD BE
ROTATED ON A CIRCULAR TRACK WITH AN ANGULAR PRECISION
OF ABOUT 0.2 DEGREES.
THE RELATIVE NEUTRON FLUX WAS DETERMINED USING
A TOF NEUTRON MONITOR CONSISTING OF A 5 CM DIAMETER BY
5 CM THICK PLASTIC SCINTILLATOR.
THE DIFFERENTIAL CROSS SECTIONS ARE GIVEN
WITH THE STATISTICAL ERRORS ONLY. TO THIS SHOULD BE
ADDED THE SCALE UNCERTAINTY, WHICH WAS ESTIMATED TO
BE LESS THAN 5 PERCENT FOR THE STATES STUDIED.
THE ANGLE-INTEGRATED CROSS SECTIONS ARE GIVEN WITH
TOTAL ERRORS.
STUDSVIK 6 MV VAN DE GRAAFF ACCELERATOR, EQUIPPED
WITH A TERMINAL PULSING AND KLYSTRON BUNCHING SYSTEM,
AS WELL AS A POST-ACCELERATION BUNCHER. DELIVERED
BURSTS OF 5 MEV DEUTERONS AT A REPETITION RATE OF 1
MHZ WITH A PULSE WIDTH AT HALF MAXIMUM OF LESS THAN
0.3 NS AND AN AVERAGE BEAM CURRENT OF 3 MICROAMPS.
TARGET CELL OF 1.0 CM LENGTH FILLED WITH TRITIUM
GAS TO A PRESSURE OF UP TO 4 ATM. THE MOLYBDENUM
ENTRANCE WINDOW OF THE CELL HAD A THICKNESS OF 4
MG/CM2, AND WAS CLAMPED WITH 0.1 MM THICK INDIUM
O-RINGS BETWEEN SLIGHTLY INCLINED SURFACES. THE TOTAL
ENERGY SPREAD WAS ESTIMATED TO BE LESS THAN +/- 0.1
MEV.
TIME-OF-FLIGHT WITH FLIGHT PATH OF 4 M. TOTAL
TIME RESOLUTION WAS LESS THAN 1 NS AT A NEUTRON ENERGY
OF 21.6 MEV, CORRESPONDING TO A RESOLUTION OF 0.7 MEV.
LRL CONSTRAINED PHASE
SHIFTS.
.HOLLOW CYLINDERS OF 5.0 CM HEIGHT, OUTER DIAMETER OF
2.5 CM AND INNER DIAMETER OF 1.0 CM, BEING OF NATURAL
ISOTOPIC COMPOSITIONS. THE NITROGEN AND OXYGEN SAMPLES
WERE IN THE FORM OF SILICON COMPOUNDS, I.E. SI3N4 AND
SIO2, RESPECTIVELY. A PURE SILICON SAMPLE WAS USED FOR
BACKGROUND MEASUREMENTS.
THE MONITOR SAMPLE WAS A PARALLELEPIPEDIC PIECE OF
POLYETHYLENE WITH THE DIMENSIONS 5.0 X 2.5 X 0.8 CM.
THE SAMPLES WERE POSITIONED AT A DISTANCE OF 14.5 CM
IN FRONT OF THE TARGET.
.DATA OBTAINED FROM N.OLSSON 89/10/06.
.ANGLE-INTEGRATED CROSS SECTIONS WERE OBTAINED FROM
LEGENDRE POLYNOMIAL FITS TO THE EXPERIMENTAL DATA.
.DATA OBTAINED FROM N.OLSSON 89/10/06.
